newsitem.title: UK: Kalamazoo slumps after profit warning.
newsitem.headline: Kalamazoo slumps after profit warning.

text.p: Shares in Kalamazoo Computer Group Plc tumbled on Monday after the company warned that its results for the year ended March 31 would fall short of analyst expectations.

In a brief trading statement, Kalamazoo said it had discovered breaches of internal rules in its UK Business Solutions unit which meant that results in that division's management accounts "do not accurately reflect its performance."
It said a review of those breaches had been carried out and all the individuals responsible were "no longer with the group".
Kalamazoo's auditors Deloitte & Touche were assisting with a review of internal controls, it said.
The stock was down 22p, or 22 percent, at 77-1/2 by 1400 GMT.
